place_description: This charming gathering place draws a crowd for its pastries, light fare & coffee drinks.

reviews_data.review_text: Saturday night, the pastry section was mostly empty. I am ok with that assuming they bake things fresh and want to avoid wastage but the prices were ridiculous on the scraps that were left. They need to halve the prices on some of their products or double the portion size. US price+ French portion size= No Thanks.

The reason of my two star rating is because the service was so slow and also they were not very friendly. It seemed there was a chaos behind the counter. The pastry was not bad, but they were not exceptional. Overpriced on the drinks side as Starbucks has a better coffee/espresso and selection. Limited parking as well.
No, just no. The macrons are not good. If you have any self respect skip.

Fun decor & pastry case looks amazing but this place is mid at best. Not a true French patisserie but a watered down kitschy American version. Not sure anything is actually made in house?  Coffees & pastries turned out to be a major disappoint and service was poor. Won't be back and really don't recommend if looking for good coffee & pastries.

The atmosphere is really good. The service is slow. We stopped in for a quick snack and coffee. After seeing flies landing on the food, we lost our appetite and just got coffee only. I mentioned it to the lady behind the counter, and she said she would take care of it, yet they kept serving the food with flies. You lost my business for sure.

I have pictures, but can't see anyplace to upload while leaving this review.
Delicious and a cool vibe!

We ordered a French dip sandwich. $11.25. The sandwich had 2 thin sliced pieces of roast beef that were dry as a board. Swiss cheese that was barely there. The entire sandwich was only half an inch thick which was mostly bread. It was cold as well. Very disappointed. Do better.

A must stop when I'm in Charlotte! I usually go to a different location, but this one was just as good! They were pretty busy, but the service was still pretty quick! We tried a few different varieties of macaroons, fruit tarts, and the pecan tart was amazing! Great bakery if you're in the area!
Amazing and Beautiful!  It's just always freezing and you can't enjoy too much time there.
Had to wait which wasn't unexpected for a Sunday, but ended up getting an iced coffee instead of hot. Food portions were also pretty small for the price.
Watermelon cookies was great and the strawberry

i got a lavender macaron, palmier, croissant, and a pistachio coconut latte. the latte, macaron, and croissant were all lovely but the palmier tasted a little stale to me. the woman at the cash register was rude when i asked for a drink recommendation. overall, i liked the vibe and the cafe itself is expansive with some interesting decorations/art
Delicious food and pastries.  I forgot to take a picture of my creme brulee but it was delicious!

The French would be so insulted. Looked so fake and corporate in there; the food was terrible and bland. I felt like I was in a themed amusement park restaurant. The way it was hyped up I thought it was a locally owned place with an actual French patisserie/cafe vibe. I dont know why this place is so lauded since the food is tasteless & overpriced, purely because they market as "French." I'm most upset that I wasted about $26 on a breakfast and dessert when I could have gone literally anywhere else for something satisfying. I'm glad I finally tried it though, now I know. The service was fine, the coffee was fine, but I would not recommend coming here for the food, dessert or otherwise.
Food was delicious and the decor is unique. The service could have been more efficient but they did a great job as well. An excellent place if you aren't in too much of a rush

Great vibe! Even better food and customer service.

**My #1 Go-To spot for friend gatherings.  They love it and I do too.
Going this place from beginning to end, they have improved step by step , quality is awesome

Have people in Charlotte never had good food? The reviews on here are wild. I've gotten better baked goods and desserts at Whole Foods. They don't even look pretty and that's the whole point of patisserie (have y'all not watched Bake-off)? Says a lot about the food scene here... very underwhelming.

Husband took me here for my birthday. I felt like a little school girl to see the various assortments of sweets & such. It was a complete surprise to me but I Loved it here We had tarts, mousse, and an entremet- cute place for a cute tea time with your girls.. HIGHLY recommend

Definitely have to get the chocolate croissant and ask to heat it up a lil bit. Of course you have to get it with a coffee! Personally, their fruit tarts are my fav. They're packed with blue berries, strawberries, and some kiwi!
Easy to order online but coffee is not good. Haven't tried any of the food though!

We waited in line while a worker counted items in the case rather than waiting on a customer. I asked how do we order and she said two names of people we don't know chatted incessantly to other customers. The napoleon I got was one of the worst I have ever had and I have eaten them for 50 years. This is the second and last time I will frequent this business. I have no idea why people like it. Your service was horrible, I imagine this was a manger. I thought you might help us but no, you basically said I don't care just wait.

Lovely popping French ambience with a wide variety of delicious, high quality pastries and beverages with decent portions and slightly above average prices ($5-6 for pastries and $3-4 for small beverages). They have ample seating, Wi-Fi and good restrooms.

Our favorites were the creme brulee (not too sweet), espresso bomb (great flavor and very smooth) and the chai latte (perfect sweetness and flavor).

The tiramisu latte was also good but was a bit sweeter than expected.

They have a large variety of macaroons too.

Great coffee
Too pricey for everything though

Mediocre French goodies.. always a long line.  Staff is haphazard and unorganized. Wasn't super happy to learn that they don't actually make a lot of the stuff there, and there isn't anything French about them at all. Talk about cultural appropriation for profit.
In Charlotte for the weekend! Absolutely amazing! Tried multiple pastries! The coffee! All the things! Beautiful place! Great service! So quirky and fun! Loved it all!!!!
5 star biscuit breakfast sandwich. Almost a cross between a biscuit and croissant. Coffee is top notch. Everything is good
Cute french bakery with a lot of art references  and decor. The ambiance is lovely. The coffee was great. However, the tiramisu and creme brulee were too sweet for my taste.

Wow! This new location and employees are incredible. I have been a customer of Amelie's for 13 years, but this most recent experience with the wonderful employee, Natasha, has been the best! She was patient and answered questions about the macarons, and then went above and beyond by helping me keep the flavors straight in a labeled box. I am so grateful.
So many yummy desserts   Loved the macaroons
Cashier attitude a tad unfriendly. Bakery, nice presentation but very underwhelming taste. Sandwiches not very tasty. Turkey over salted and small bread slices. Very cool decoration. Good coffee.

Macarons were delicious. Also got a strawberry dome shaped dessert that I forget the name of. Fiance and I got coffee and the kids got lemonades. All of it was delicious and the staff was very friendly and helpful.

THIS WAS MY FIRST TIME THERE I LOVE THE INSIDE, IT A BEAUTIFUL PLACE TO HAVE ME AND FRIEND  TO HAVE COFFEE AND FRENCH PASTRY AND FEEL LIKE YOU ON PARIS , NOW I HAVE A NEW PLACE TO GO TOO,  GOOD JOB.  BB

The place is beautiful, the paintings, the decoration, the food very delicious, the desserts unique but the bathrooms very dirty. They must be more careful. What's the point of a beautiful restaurant with disgusting bathrooms???
Amelie's has the best desserts and I love the Eiffel Tower decor in the back.

My company hired Amelie's to cater a professional event we were hosting. From the moment we engaged their services, they were wonderful to work with, and made the planning process extremely easy. Anytime I had questions, they were quick to respond and always friendly and kind. On the day of the event, they showed up early and arranged the food and beverages on the tables in a perfect manner. Their prices were far superior to any local catering company, and we would absolutely hire them again for our next event.

The salted caramel brownie is delicious, but it's rich. I had difficulty eating it in one sitting, but that left me with leftovers.

The coffee is really good, but the barista was on the slow side.
Friendly staff, GREAT atmosphere, and the BEST pastries and desserts in Charlotte!! The fruit yogurt tart is my favorite!
Took my wife and 2 daughters atmosphere was chillax patrons were laid back staff was friendly smiling dope vibes and an inviting place to do some work ,conversations, or night cap
It was a fun experience with delicious treats.

The service was good and so was my pastry. However, at the time of my visit (10:30pm Friday, April 19th), there was a pungent odor of sewage. I've never experienced it before and there were no signs explaining it. Even when I sat in the back room, I could  smell it.
Very neat spot. Lots of ambience and very tasty pastries.

The desserts are okay. Coffee is really average. Matcha latte wasn't good at all.
Floors and tables aren't cleaned off had to walk around to find a clean table.
I love Amelie's!!! They have such good food and pastries, my favorite place to study!! Although their bathrooms are gross and really need to be cleaned

Incompetent service, ordered a drink and never received it. Told the cashier didn't properly submit it and I would have to get back in line. Very disappointing.

However the food that I did receive that was properly rang up was good so silver lining.
So, many fabulous looking treats. I had the strawberry creme tart .  If I lived there it would be a once aweek stop.
While visiting Charlotte we stopped here Sunday morning for coffee and ended up with an Almond Croissant and Quiche Lorraine. Both were very good and the coffee was good as well. Recommend!

This bakery has a great atmosphere. They have a fantastic selection of pastries. It is a little pricey but the quality of the food and the decorum of the bakery makes it well worth it. We have been back many times.
Loved the decor. Coffee was great and so was their Creme Brulee.

Must Try pastries
1. Chocolate petit gateaux - 10/10
2. Espresso Entrement - 10/10

All the other pastries are 5/10.

This place is a bit overrated. The pastries are ok. They are somewhat overpriced in my opinion, and I've never been too blown away over anything that I've tried. There are some great bakeries around town where you can get more bang for your buck. I DO, however, recommend their soups, salads and sandwiches. Never had one that I didn't like. They are always fresh and full of flavor.

I absolutely love this place and anytime I go in here I always spend over $50 in pastries to bring home to my family. I went there yesterday and bought a dozen macarons. Today, I had to throw 5 of them in to the trash because they were inedible. I almost broke a took on the birthday cake cookie and then went for another and the entire shell on  both sides just shattered and went everywhere. Y'all charge $30 plus tax for 12 cookies and half of them end up being useless. I'm just disappointed because I don't live in town, so going to this bakery is always something I look forward to and I'm just going to stop wasting my money on food that can't be eaten

Very bad experience very rude and racist staff by name brian today at Noda location i used to come here but never again as I was today around 9:45pm there with my friends and we had 2 kids around age of 2 and like all kids they were moving around our table but with in 15 minutes brian told us YOU CAN LEAVE NOW and we were stunned without further incident we left and this guy is extremely racist rude and disrespectful because we were muslims and we saw he said same this to another group of muslims sitting there with kid if the owner or general manager reads this review this employee is very bad influence for your business he is rude and disrespectful he should never work at front in retail

This is the worst experience i ever had at any Cafe. My friend's son was playing and running around and then one of the employee Brian probably the manager came to our table and asked us to leave the Cafe. This is the most humiliating experience I have been through. At the same time he asked another Muslim family to leave as well because their little daughter was playing around too. This is Racism. I didn't know it is a Child-Free cafe. If it is there should be a sign of NO KIDS ALLOWED.
The manager Brain very rude person, this place not children friendly,I have very bad experience with them.
Hermoso todo!

This place is awesome! I have to say the creme brulee and tiramisu was the best i have had! The atmosphere was great and it was decorated really cool. Seems like a great cafe to come and do a little work at as well. Can't wait to go back and try more treats!

Everything we tried: croissant, salted caramel brownie, tiramisu, lemon raspberry tart, creme brulee, and salted caramel mocha

10/10 recommend the treats.

Do not recommend the bathrooms unless you really gotta go. they were not very clean and the sinks were super small i could barely wash my hands without touching some part of the sink. Had to walk into three bathrooms before selecting so there is not regular cleaning (and seemingly some inconsiderate customers)

I have never had an issue with Amelie's. So it is very disappointing to share the experience I had this morning.  Bright and early at 7 AM I went there to get something to eat.  Immediately, it seemed as though young girl with the ponytail this morning, 7 AM, was not very happy that I didn't know exactly what I wanted, immediately. More importantly, when I received my order, which was the blueberry muffin that was warmed.  The same girl young girl with the ponytail, took the item out of the oven, put it in plastic container, walked toward the cashier and....just held her hand out. I repeat, Just held her hand out. My son and I was standing away from the front counter, about 3 meters. She said nothing. My son whom I didn't get to stop in time, walked over to her to get it. Which, of course, she said nothing. Not thank you, not Have a nice day. Nothing.
My son took the plastic container from her hand and, picked up the other plastic container on the counter.  Once we were on our way, he realized it was not the right order.  So, sometime this morning Amelie's must have realized a French Toast order was not received. Whose fault is that? The young girl with the ponytail from the 7am shift this morning.
We all have days we're tired or such. However, Customer Service  is of most importance. I'm not sure what excuse Ms. Young Lady has, but I do hope I will not experience this anymore. Amelie's has always been a fav of mine.
The macarons are the best!

Decent food, great decor but the wait time outweighs it all. Only one person on the register, one person boxing pastries and one person making drinks and the line was out the door. To complete one transaction took 3-5 minutes. Would suggest ordering ahead to beat the wait.
What a place! Best Coffee in town.  Ambiance is awesome.
Mediocre at best.  Cafe au lait was nothing special.  Piece of cake/gateau at $6.50 a piece was dry, cream and frosting was hard.  Never what you would expect to taste in a cake by looking at it.
Matcha tastes like hot water and milk. Barely any matcha
Amelie's is a longtime favorite. It's a cute spot open later than most.
I wish they had more assortment....

One of the best macarons are available here. They have wide varieties of bakery selection.
Customer service is top notch . Interior is at best. Perfect place to spend with dear ones.
BTW they have good sandwiches and coffees too.
It's a cool spot to have a coffee and some pastries. It is a bit crowded though, but they have interesting stuff like tartines that taste really good. The strawberry petit gatou is also quite good.

Very disappointing. This was my first visiting Charlotte in a year and I was really looking forward to my usual order here. The vanilla macaron was stale and I couldn't eat it. The recipe for the strawberry petite gateau has changed and it just fell short. The texture it very different and I prefer the previous buttercream they used that was firm. The coconut macaroon was still very good. I also ordered a black drip coffee and had to wait more than 15 minutes for all the other lattes to be made vs the cashier handing me my drip as is typical at most places. The staff was very friendly.

Very whimsical and eclectic vibe--we loved it! Coffees and food were great. The tables were dirty, though and there was trash on the floor beneath the tables (and sticky floors in the back). As travelers, cleanliness in a restaurant is paramount. If what the customers see is unclean what are the areas they don't see like?

Amelie's is much more than pastries and dessert's. Their spinach asparagus soup and mandarin and goat cheese salad is my favorite lunch. I always add salmon for extra protein. Their food is made fresh daily and exceptional!
Desserts overpriced & average. Amazing monte cristo sandwich. Extremely helpful employees. Nicely decorated & spacious.
Just a terrific place for a coffee, pastries, and more. My cappuccino and fruit tart were delicious - and at fair prices.

Our first visit was overall great! Had a few different items. The fruit tart, lemon raspberry tart, and salted caramel brownie were very tastie. The chocolate eclair wasn't as good as I hoped but it was decent. They have a wide variety of French Macarons looking forward to trying them.
I don't normally write reviews but I had to come on here and say Amelie's has the best chai tea latte I've ever had in my life
This place is so unique and highly recommend if you live in Charlotte or just visiting. The line is always long on the weekends but was worth the wait.

Took a short trip to Charlotte and found this gem.
Sidenote: Wine is no longer a part of the menu.

Used to visit often when I lived in S.C. The most charming cafe on planet earth Sad it's no longer 24 hours having hot latte and dessert  at 2 am was always treat! Will be a lifelong customer only live in Miami now so can't visit that often. Viva Amelie

Not sure why the cheese danishes have been out of stock prior to Christmas. The reason given when called to the store is that ALL Amelie's are going to stop serving them but when you call other stores they still have them in stock and no knowledge of getting rid of them. So strange!

Amelie's French Bakery & Cafe is a charming culinary haven that transports visitors to the heart of France with its delightful ambiance and delectable offerings. Nestled in [City], this bakery is a true gem, combining the warmth of a cafe with the artistry of French pastry.

The moment you step inside, the aroma of freshly baked goods envelops you, creating a sensory experience that foreshadows the culinary delights to come. The quaint decor, reminiscent of a Parisian boulangerie, enhances the overall charm.

The menu at Amelie's is a celebration of French culinary expertise. From flaky croissants to decadent eclairs, each pastry is a masterpiece. The selection extends beyond pastries, encompassing savory delights and gourmet sandwiches that showcase a commitment to quality ingredients and authentic flavors.

What sets Amelie's apart is the whimsical creativity infused into every creation. The vibrant colors and intricate designs of the pastries not only please the palate but also the eye. It's a place where indulgence meets artistry.

The cafe's commitment to a welcoming atmosphere is reflected in its attentive and friendly staff. Whether you're a connoisseur of French cuisine or a casual visitor, the staff's passion for their craft enhances the overall experience.

In addition to the outstanding food and ambiance, Amelie's often serves as a community hub, hosting events and fostering a sense of togetherness. The commitment to community engagement adds an extra layer of appeal.

In conclusion, Amelie's French Bakery & Cafe is more than a culinary destination; it's a journey to the heart of France. With its exquisite pastries, inviting ambiance, and a touch of whimsy, it stands as a testament to the art of French baking and a must-visit for anyone seeking a taste of Parisian charm in [City].

I've gone to Amelia's for years and normally love it, but today I got a Tiramisu latte and I got to the end of it and tasted something slimy but also gritty. At that moment I assumed I was drinking some grounded up espresso beans but when I took the lid off I discovered that wasn't the case. This is what was in the bottom of my latte and I had a sip of.
Unique atmosphere and delicious pastries

guy with tattoos at til, if your going to be the face of your cafe, please at least know your menu properly.
Ordered two drinks one was a strawberry cucumber lemonade ( if it's out of season why would you have it on a menu?) Cappuccino.. TERRIBLE.
1. Your milk is burnt.
2. Your froth is more bubbly than a bubble bath.
3. Taste more like a mocha than a cappuccino.
4. Syrup should not be a topping.
5. I would gladly train your staff how to make proper coffee. Just because you're a commercial company doesn't mean you should be producing terrible coffee.
Good coffee should be paired with great sweets. If you can't do that, please stop selling coffee beverages.

That's just my opinion as a big coffee Fien.
Besides that your sweets are great.
Still great!

This is a good pastry and coffee shop with a good selection of desserts and bakery.
They do have sandwiches etc.
The french toast was not great. It was a multigrain toast i guess. Two bites were enough.
The mini tarts and coffee were good
By far the best one in the area!

Amelie's is by far one of my favorite dessert places.  The decor is always on point,  and their selection is wide and yummy!!!

Great food and desserts alike.
This place is awesome !
Delicious baked goods, friendly and helpful people at the counter, and the decor and atmosphere is quite unique and beautifully done with a few whimsical touches. Stop by and treat yourself!

Driving through Charlotte mid morning on a Sunday and was looking for a bakery cafe. This humdinger popped up with a 4.6 and 6,600 reviews! Wow, we had to try it.

Good stuff:
Atmosphere was amazing! Had a fun play on French art and history. Really bright and colorful.
Cranberry chicken salad sandwich on a croissant was great!

Less Cool Items:
Regular croissants are not cooked long enough. They are buttery and big, but lack a golden flaky crust that really defines a croissant. Great for a sandwich but not to eat alone.
The quiche was burnt on the bottom and way over salted in the middle. Couldn't eat the crust (pictured)
The French toast description looked divine... but the brioche was dry and sliced ultra thin; not what anyone would want in a luscious bite of French toast. Also, the syrup was fridge cold. (Pictured)
The pastries were meh, kind of like day old baked goods with lots of sugar.
We bought six macaroons to give away to friends back home because they were beautiful. After eating one, they were very chewy and overly sweet. The remaining five stayed in our fridge for a few days before being tossed out untouched.

Overall it was disappointing. I was amazed at the large crowds while simultaneously sad that they haven't experienced a true quaint cafe and bakery found on just about every street corner in Paris. I wish them continued success and hope they work on tweaking their recipe's.

If you know about bakeries you love this place is authentic French flavor in each dessert. Customer of Amelie, since the beginning, I say, they have kept the flavor throughout the years. Macaroons are the bomb in the picture you have cotton candy cake my favorite is always gonna be the cream Brule my daughter Chose the red velvet cheesecake, and it was mouth watery. Very quiet place to read a book study or meeting with France. We are PACked but the good thing is they have room everywhere.

Excellent service; kind and knowledgeable personnel, just a little slow making the drinks but worth the wait. Deserts are heavenly! The espresso entremet and the salted caramel brownie torte were our favorites. Decor was adorable!

Very bad experience with a rude lady who works there. I waited for a long time to get my order just to found out they got me the wrong items. When I requested my right item and gave them back the wrong one the rude lady asked in a very unpleasant tone to throw it away myself. Definitely not coming back to this place.
This is my first time visiting this location and it's quite lovely! My Cafe Marcotter was delicious and beautiful.

The employees were casual and lackadaisical about their jobs as if they  were there for social hours and not to get paid. They stood behind the counter chatting it up as waited for our food for 30 minutes. No one could even bother to bring the drinks to the table. This was a completely different tone from the first 2 times I visited this place. I'm really disappointed and probably won't return. Waiting 30 minutes for the food or more is completely unacceptable.  My friend ended up trying to wave someone over to ask if that was her drink just sitting in the counter for the last 20 minutes and instant of bringing it over to the table the lazy young lady just spoke to us, the consumers, from across the counter that you have to come get it. Are you serious right now? Absurd! We didn't have to do that the last time we were there.  We even ordered at a different  end of the counter on this visit. I was really impressed with this small Cafe the first couple of times I went. This third visit made me hate that I spent my hard earned money on subpar service and food, for people who can't bother to get my order correct or to make sure their patrons are taken care of. That's why it took me so long to do the review because I get so pissed everytime I think about it. Although I've yet to try one of the patries, and i was really looking forward to it, but I seriously doubt I will return.

This is an adorable little spot hidden away in the corner of a residential neighborhood, that's easily missed if you don't know what you're looking for. Like other Amelie's locations, they are mostly well known for their pastries and coffee, but I went with a friend to sample their other menu items.
I ordered a wrap, and she, the French onion dip(officially, some kind of toasted beef sandwich with melted cheese that you dunk in the bowl of French onion). Both were incredibly hot and fresh. It was delivered to our table in a timely manner, and it tasted pretty consistent with other locations.
Not too expensive, and the decorations were fun and lighthearted. I attached images about the surrounding visuals just so you can get a better sense of the atmosphere. I give it top marks for a chill afternoon rendezvous.
When we arrived it was already black dark out, but the place was still fairly packed. I figure they must be doing something right. Not exactly my scene, but I completely get it. We were there for about 3 hours talking, and the staff didn't bother us at all.
I wouldn't recommend it if you're looking to study, or write over your coffee. It was much too loud for that. Many parents brought crying children, and they seemed almost encouraged to let them run around at a breakneck pace. Don't come if you expect relaxation. It's more like a tiki bar, or a mall terminal. Teens and young adults are heavily encouraged to visit.
4/5 is fair.
Bought several kinds of cheesecake,different colors of macaron lol, supposed to be in different flavors. Delicious. Outside it looks just so so. Inside it is gorgeous. Love the decoration there.

Fantastic place to go for dessert! I decided this time to try the chicken salad croissant and found it to be very creamy and delicious. Nice large portion too. I also got a hot chocolate which was chocolaty and had lots of whipped cream! My friend got a fruit salad which she said was good. I recommend this  bakery and will go back to try their salad and always yummy desserts!

I came and ordered for takeout. I asked how long it would take as I had to catch a train and was told about 10 minutes. Took almost 20 minutes to come out with a sandwich a soup and 2 small side salads. The service was slow at the counter leaving the person who got the desserts to ring us up as the cashier just went off to do something else. The sandwich was medioacre as something tasted funny with the avocado spread and they did not include the dressings on one of the salads we ordered.
No dogs allowed!? What years is this?

Hello Viewers,

Before I departed from Charlotte from my last day of the business, I was browsing around and see if there are any local Cafe, and I decided to go Amelie French bakery & cafe for my last stop.  This is my second french bakery shop for my breakfast.  I am guessing Charlotte has a lot of French influence?  my requirement is simple, as long as cafe provides specious work/relax environment, variety of the foods, and ok internet connection, they are my go-to cafe, and this Amelie's French bakery & cafe is definitely one of them.  (I did not go to another one, so I can't be sure the others)

French bakery shop is known for their sweet tooth bakery, and they offer any possible pastry that you can think of.  on the top, the shop also offer breakfast sandwich, lunch style food offer the  customers from the whole journey from savory to sweet, cold to hot.  I order Monte Cristo with cappuccino and ending with petite pecan tart, they are freshly made and delicious to eat.   this cafe is spacious I estimate can fit around 50 people comfortably, in fact the place is too big the store decoration is a bit eccentric that they put everything French related into the decoration.   I guess it's the French style that everything needs to be add to the flourish 

in summary, if you visiting Charlotte town, please be sure to spend around 3 hours to visit Amelie's cafe to enjoy the delicious foods, comfortable seating, and kind staff.

P.S - did I mention their internet Is fast?   

Paul

Today's experience at Amelie's was more impactful than each soul that participated in this may realize. After struggling with some things in my personal life, I chose to come here for a mid-day escape. Immediately upon entering, I was greeted with the biggest, most genuine smiles. The sweet lady with the blue hair was not only so professional but also welcoming. The gentleman with the glasses at the register was beyond kind and seemed to have the attitude of someone who strives to make everyones day better in anyway he can. Even down to the person who brought out my food, so much care was had for me as someone who just simply ordered a sandwich. I can't express the impact this experience had on me. It brought me to tears at my table. You never know what someone is going through and how massive such a simple interaction can mean to them. I would love for everyone who manages or has any higher position with Amelies to know that these three individuals not only changed my day but also left a massive impact on me. Thank you!
Wonderful place. Highly recommended.
I live in the 7 cities area of Virginia, I havnt been in Charlotte  seance 2010, anyone I talk to about Charlotte talks about amalies, such an amazing place

Great place but the line is SO slow.  Please make your origin idea somehow work with registers going at both sides.  I often don't want pastries at all and have to wait for everyone that does!   It is a bit unreasonable to wait literally 30 minutes just to get a coffee.

Also get a nice pinot noir wine please.

Edit:  moved to one star. if possible, they have got even slower.   They have one person working the register and one person manning the pastries. During Saturday morning rush!  If you don't have enough people working then start paying more!   You definitely charge enough for things!  I'm not coming back ever again if I see any kind of a line because your food and drinks are not worth an hour of my life!  Get your act together!
Fun kitschy place with the best coffee I've ever had, this side of the Atlantic! The twice-baked almond croissant was perfectly flaky and perfectly delicious. Wish there was an Amelie's in my area.

Loved this place! We went here for lunch with a large group. We were attending a Juice Plus+ conference. The restaurant was able to accommodate a large number of people from the conference (not just our party) quickly. Food was great and reasonably priced. Would definitely recommend!!

Very popular bakery in NoDa/ Charlotte and the interior design is very fun. There is a Eiffel tower inside the cafe, very creative to whoever idea it was.
Everything is good just like most reviews, but to me, watch out for the bake goods that are not in the fridge. They can be dry sometimes. Pull-apart bread and turnovers.
Coffee, tarts, macaroons are my usual orders.
Plenty of people just to sit there and work/study, good hangout spots for friends and families too
The ambiance is delightful, making it an excellent spot to relax and enjoy with friends. The food is delicious and reasonably priced, adding to the overall positive experience.
I got a little French silk pie and an earl grey tea macaron. Both were good but the macaron was absolute FIRE. And the environment is so fun and interesting!

Love this eclectic bakery nestled in NoDa in Charlotte.

The service was inviting. As a first-timer, the host was knowledgeable about the pastries and everything offered in the bakery. She also gave Christmas gift suggestions. I got the pound cake with yogurt. It was fresh and filling.

The shop is laced with creative artwork with beautiful bold colors. The shop is spacious and there is ample parking.

I ordered a tiramisu, I literally got a frozen  one... I can buy frozen tiramisu in Walmart lol 

Definitely the desserts are not fresh!!
Absolute beautiful environment! Food was amazing. Will definitely visit again.

I spent $20+ on a breakfast sandwich and coffee and the sandwich was basically all of the components thrown into a box, but not as a sandwich. Disappointed to say the least. The coffee was good though.

I visited Amelie's NoDa back in the spring and almost left a review, but decided that I may have caught the restaurant on a down day, so thought I'd give it a second chance. Today I stopped by again and it was as bad as I remembered.  First off, the bathroom was so disgusting, I had to report it to staff.  Horrible smell of urine in the "gender neutral" bathroom, graffiti on the door, no mirror over the sink-I felt like I was in a run down gas station bathroom. Secondly, my chicken salad was so bland and tasteless, and the croissant tasted like it was made last week- it was so dry I could barely swallow! Amelie's used to be a great restaurant in NoDa, before they relocated, but the new NoDa location is an absolute disappointment and a completely overrated establishment. I won't be returning.
If you're an adult that genuinely likes Disney World, you will enjoy this place.
Good items and location... Yummy!!
I love this place!  Great pastries and cakes,  and a good coffee/tea selection as well
mm sanwhich

Great friendly atmosphere, largely  clean, and spacious. Also, there is ample  parking in the lot and also on the street in back of the facility. The food is very good . However, the portions are small. Therefore, this is not the place to go if you are very hungry. Gluten free selections are available but limited. Service staff aims to please so if you are a finicky lactose and gluten intolerant person like me, they will accommodate and build sandwiches to your liking.

We had a great time trying out the different bakery items. Macaron and almond cruffin were particularly tasty! Hot chocolate was fine. The interior of this place is wonderful! It has Paris vibes and a lovely place to sit and enjoy with your friends.

I do love this place, but it smells so bad when you enter. I tried to stay to do some work but I could not handle the overpowering smell. I leave this review for improvement.  Cleanliness is important especially if there's pastries/food involved.
I did love the coffee and the chocolate croissant!
Amazing ng eats and even better coffee
A little piece of France in Charlotte! Love, love Amelie's!

If there's one thing you MUST try. It is the leak soup. That should be the only reason you come to Amelie's on North Tryon. The leak soup was shun by many. Many have doubted the leak soup. Before coming to Amelie's on North Tryon, the things I heard about leak soup, well to put it short, it's not anything I would say to a young growing child. Furthermore. I love leak soup. Leak laugh love

Waiting in line here is a study in the sunken cost fallacy. Once you're in line, you try and estimate how long it will take. For a bakery that is known for being open late, to have one person getting pastries, while another sits doing nothing other than being on the phone as the other runs around, clearly breaking a sweat, shows lack of training. And for that person, who's one job appears to be to ring up very simple orders to look perturbed when someone dares interrupt their browsing is annoying to say the least. There needs to be a dedicated coffee line. Food quality is good, but ruined by bad service.
Delicious pastries
Every interaction I have experienced with a staff member named Amy has not been pleasant, at all.  Once I walk in and notice she is at the front counter, I almost always don't want to walk in.

I absolutely love this place! It's a beautiful spot to relax and enjoy some of the most incredible desserts I've ever had. The ambiance is charming, with cozy seating and lovely decor that creates a welcoming atmosphere.
It is a popular and safe place to meet up with friends and do discussion groups.
So delicious.  We love this place so much.  Everything is so good.
Amelie's has tons of awesome pastries. The eclairs and macaroons are two of the standouts.
Coffee is incredible! Alana was so friendly and helpful!
Opening times wrong on webpage.

I miss the old Amelie's. Too many of my favorite items have been downgraded to flavorless and/or cardboard-y. Tart shells are hard and flavorless is comparison with the old ones. Baguettes have less flavor and seem to dissolve into mush when you use them to soak up soup. Spinach Asparagus Leek soup has lost flavor and creaminess.  I used to love so many things here, and I hate how much I struggle to enjoy Amelie's these days. Incredibly disappointing
Best of the best

This local bakery has several locations in Charlotte, and this vibe / environment is so fun! It's overwhelming trying to find a bakery item to pick because they all look amazing! The Napoleon is phenomenal! I also got a twice baked chocolate croissant to go, and enjoyed it the next morning - also incredible. I don't think you can go wrong with anything! I'll have to go back and try their cafe menu items. Definitely check it out!
This place is unique; decoration is modern with pieces that's remain French. And the coffee is great.
It's like Alice in Wonderland with great coffee and delicious baked treats.
My regular goto place for coffee , chocolate eclair and Chicken croissants .
Love the birthday cake macarons!
Very nice place, lots of options and it's open 24/7

The Employees

The two cashiers who were on the afternoon shift today, July 29, serve with a bad attitude, they are arrogant when placing orders and that makes them make mistakes in the orders.

Went to Amelie's newest location on 36th Street for desserts. Had the Lemon Raspberry Tart, Birthday Cake Macaroons,  Cinnamon Roll, and Lemon Bar. They were all amazing! The crust are so buttery and I could taste real pieces of lemon zest in the Lemon Bar!   Seating was good, with a very nice atmosphere . Parking was not an issue this time of day (early evening after 5pm).
Delicious coffee and bakery. Eclectic and pleasant atmosphere.
this food is fantastic

Such a charming gem. We absolutely loved the decor. The assortment in the bakery was divive. The chocolate croissant was simply decadent. We actually enjoyed every treat that we've tried from this place.
I wish they would keep the pastries in the cake dome. It was dried out and flies flying on them.

Delicious, what else is there to say, the macrons were phenomenal, the banana creme tart was great. I had never been to the 36th st location before, it has a great feel and eclectic look to it and of course all the bakery items were delicious. We will definitely be coming back.
Yummy

after being in Paris this was a nice little treat! Definitely love the Paris themed decor and the food was amazing. We had a turkey baguette, macarons, and a roast beef croissant sandwich. Croissants were good but Paris is still #1 and the baguette was amazing
Absolutely a must go, I go every time I come into town. Just the best place, Have never had a bad baked good, or menu option. The salads have mini croissants as the croutons!! Come on

So I've been coming to Amelie's for years. Today I was really let down. Y'all microwaved my French toast. Tuff and chewy is not a pleasant experience. I spent almost $40 in here and won't do it again. The girl wasn't listening to my order and it came out Togo after three times I said for here. Then lady rang up my macaroons and not my breakfast so my rewards weren't accurate. This really won't matter as I'm done with y'all. And the transgender bathrooms had no soap and toilet would not flush
5 stars arent enough to rate this paradise!!!
The two cashiers today on my visit were rude to me and my family, they have no respect for the Latino community, what a bad experience I had

Got here at 1:30 on a Saturday planning to eat lunch, waited in line to order for 30 minutes, and then when I finally got to the front, they told me the kitchen wasn't taking orders at the moment? And they didn't know when it would reopen?

The whole reason I came here was to eat - why would they not tell me that I couldn't order food before I waited 30 minutes in line.

Normally love this place, but this time left a sour taste in my mouth and I don't know if I will be back.

Waited in line for 20 min and we got up there and they said they aren't making sandwiches right now. I asked how long and they said at least 30 minutes but can't promise it will be that short. Why were we not informed we couldn't order food before waiting?
Very nice place, not too busy like the other ones.
Great pastries & fun atmosphere!

My favorite pastry shop. I've been going to Amelies since they open I'm there every Saturday between 8:45 and 9:00 today I decided to try theFrench toast they brought me the French toast the plate was cold the toast was cold and the syrup  to put on the toast was cold. They gave me another order,but everyone was finished eating .

I've made many trips here and I've never experienced anything like today. Lily was very unprofessional. she made rude comments about me not knowing what pastries are. Come on! Seriously!?? The first and only thing to showcase your customer service is trying to be a smart***. Sorry, but not sorry!

Amelie's became "Emily in Paris" with the move. The flagship location was intimate and the eclectic decor fit the overall art district vibe of NoDa. The new location is a cafeteria, very corporate/chain vibe that is just soulless. I can understand the flagship was cramped, especially with COVID concerns, but all of the space meant no privacy and it was very echo-y and just not a pleasant experience. The ordering process is now very much like a McD's or something, definitely not personable in any way. The room didn't have any "flow" past the ordering line. The art was cool, but so separated from each other that it felt chintzy/mass-produced instead of unique and local.  I could understand satellite/franchise locations using this model, but it's definitely not a Charlotte attraction any more and we didn't spend any more time there than necessary.

My pastry was on par with expectations, and I thought the staff was lovely, but not worth the 20 min drive.

The chicken salad in a sandwich was too salty.
The bakery is a better choice than sandwiches.
the staff are all fantastic and they have some of the most delicious treats i've ever tasted!! they always have such a fun variety of macaron flavors i can't resist trying every time i go!
Atmosphere was very friendly and clean! A huge choice of food, pastries, and drink for all to choose! Highly recommend the strawberry danish!

This was an awful experience coming from years of being an Amelie's customer. This bigger space has taken the cozy feeling away and your staff needs more training. No organization from counter service to checkout. And this was our first visit at your new location.

Food and beverage were perfectly fine.

The staff was absolutely horrendous. They spent the entire time complaining about pay, complaining about the amount of hours left to complete their shift. It took over 20 minutes to make a cappuccino (there was no one in line ahead.)

Multiple friends and colleagues complained of similar issues. Will not be returning until there is a complete overhaul of staffs attitude.

Went to Amelie's for a late night drink and some desserts. I got the chai latte which was warm and delicious. I also got the pecan pies that were miniature and so good. This coffee shop Is such a cute place for pictures and hanging out with friends or family. They have a whole lot of decorations from pictures frames on the wall to an Eiffel Tower in the middle of the shop and even the restrooms are decorated. Recommend this place
Muy mala experiencia especialmente ,por la persona que hace el cafe (,mujer de pelo rojo) ,muy mala actitud y poco profesional,que lastima era uno de mis mejores lugares!!

Disappointed lately. The service here is consistently slow, which may be ok if the quality was consistent. Twice now we have had to send sandwiches back due to undercooked (once completely frozen still) sausage. Wouldn't recommend anymore, which is unfortunate because the atmosphere is great and when they get the food right, it is great too.
Great vibe and the coffee was delicious!

Plenty of pastry options, creative decor, photo opportunities all over the place, all within a big location, especially for a bakery/cafe type of place.  It also comes with a lot of hype.  Unfortunately, it just didn't live up to the hype for us.  The coffee was nothing to write home about and the pastries we selected were ok at best.  We were on foot so the location seemed a bit tucked away and not easy to get to.  Not our cup of tea.
It's so nice and the dessert was awesome
Macarons are some of the best. Don't be afraid to try each one.
Patience is a virtue and only a few of the workers seem overworked and unwelcoming, place is very busy and patience is required but worth it overall
Lots to choose from and none are wrong!!! Cool environment as well.  Delish and will definitely be back!!

Absolutely delicious pastries! The mini pies are all perfectly baked and vary between light and fresh and rich and flavorful. Out of everything I ordered, the danish was the most simple and something I wouldn't have again.

Quirky atmosphere and a great breakfast spot! The Turkey & Bacon sandwich is excellent as well.
Great location and coffee

Delicious pastries and great ambiance..
Must try..

I love this cafe! The best sweets in town with beautiful and creative vibes! The people who work here are outstanding! You get the best of the best service! My kids and I love it and this place is the best date area! Highly highly recommend it!

It's a cute place with out of the box decore, employees are friendly and service was fast. With that being said I got a few different things to try; the chocolate croissant was very dense and flavorless, double baked almond croissant was confusing, macaroons are nothing out of the ordinary, eclair is ok, salted caramel latte was good. The most disappointing thing was the croque monsieur, it tasted horrible, for $10 I expected more, it had a lot of dijon mustard witch hits you as soon as you take a bite, it overpowered the flavor of everything, bechamel was split and overall the whole sandwich was bad, I was not able to finish it. I consider it to be overpriced as well and don't really get the hype.

It's a unique environment that offers a different dining experience.  We ordered  Eclair,  Creme brulee, Pecan pull apart, the salted caramel mocha drink and a double shot of expresso. The food and drinks were of high quality,  customer service was on point! Great overall experience! Be prepared as prices are $$
I had the cheese cake. It was good. The crust was sweet like a good graham cracker. The peach tea was good , could have been more peach in it. The decor was different and unique it was cute inside.
Great food!  The pic says it all.  Put this place on your foodie bucket list.

I must say that I'm rally disappointed from my experience at this location.
Waited more then an hour in line
Then more then an hour for food.
When the crescent came it was cold with more filling then actual pastry . We literally left the food on the plate and left to eat in a different place
The place is beautiful and I was expecting a lot more since we are always going to the one in south Charlotte .

Cute decor, slow service and disappointing food. Almond croissant was underbaked,  chocolate croissant was not good. Dough clearly had not been properly proofed. Hopefully the macarons we got to go will be better.
Most incredible experience I have ever had. That is an understatement!
Cute place, but the dessert did not live up to my expectations.
Delicious bakery with lovely service. I got a variety of different pastries and cakes. Everything was absolutely delicious

This is easily one of THE worst dessert cafes I've ever visited. The staff was rude and unhelpful. The tables were untidy. The dessert counter selection was poor. The parking was a mess with CMPD cars running and blocking spaces while officers relaxed at tables inside. Amelie's used to be THE place to grab coffee and pastries in Charlotte. No longer. We won't be back here, with plenty of better options throughout the region. I don't have a positive thing to say here about Amelie's.
What a treat. My beautiful girlfriend took me to this amazing place and we shared our pastries in our beautiful uptown room. Can't wait to stop in again.
Excellent
Good desserts, friendly staff, we love going with my wife
Best Bakery in Charlotte
Desserts are good, but coffees is not very good.
They make the best desserts! There is nothing that I have not tried and that I am not please with. Absolutely worth the price you pay for the quality you get.
Best macaroons known to man, and a hard to best chicken salad!
Awesome! Beautiful atmosphere & food/drinks! Great service... A MUST SEE

Coffee 10/10
Pastries  10/10
Review from a picky Coffee lover
Cute french inspired place!

Business trip to Charlotte & happened upon this cute spot! Visited at 8pm on a weeknight. No line and just a handful of patrons ( many collaborators & students studying). Clean, quirky, visual interesting. Had tea and pastries from the case. Everything was delicious. We need something like this in Orlando.

My wife had the minestrone soup and I had a leek soup and it was really good but it is very expensive for soup.  We had a couple of the macaroons, the lavender and lemon is to die for.  The blueberry macaroon didn't have much of a blueberry taste. I do love the atmosphere and the service is fantastic.
Awesome place for great desserts and getting work done. Perfect ambiance and decor. 10/10
You guys need to update the business hours I drove almost 45 minutes got here at 11:10 and the employees have everything put away and closed. It clearly says closing is at midnight. So dissatisfied

It is sad.  Just sad.  Expectations were high to only be disappointed.  Espresso was burnt and bitter.  Machine Needs to be calibrated and cleaned and staff needs to better educated.

Beautiful atmosphere and great looking pastries.  Lemon poppy seeds muffin is very sad.  It is dry, crumbly, too many large chunks of lemon zest... the muffin over all seems like it was over mixed, over baked or just past it prime.

Otherwise it's a beautiful space to come and sit for a bit.... Make you bring a blanket for warmth.
Great food, atmosphere, and service!  I came here after my cousin's recommendation and I am glad I did.  Hope yo be back soon.
Food is awesome! Atmosphere is lovely! All in all, a grand experience!!

I came to try some different items from their menu. I ordered a pastry to be heated as I like them fresh and hot, not cold or hard. After receiving my item, it was cold and tougher than it should be. It liked flavor, and the cinnamon roll topping (which I asked for extra of, and told they didn't have any more, yet behind the personal was a person makeing frash rolls with icing)after tasting it, i found it was sour and loose. It should be sweet and a thick consistency. Very disappointing. Secondly, I ordered a breakfast sandwich, which I requested to be toasted as I feel it should be warm. It was served cold. A croissant should be soft and airy and flacky. Not firm, dense, and flavorless. I have been to local bakeries. I'm from the area and have been to so much better quality barkeries with tremendous customer service.
Ugly slow service
Delicious

Terrible. I waited 40 minutes for a to-go order and watched as everyone before received what they've ordered and freebies.

I was also over charged for my order. But that's another conversation; it was only $4 so I didn't mentioned it.

moral of the story- I'm not returning.

Alana the manager is amazing. Always an excellent service and always has a smille. Makes me want to always go back.

Idriss
We always love coming for the macaroons, always so delicious! Aalana, the manager there is absolutely wonderful! Definitely goes above and beyond to make sure the experience is great!
Staff were so kind to my little ones, delicious assortment of macarons, and such a fun aesthetic!
Muy mala experiencia primera vez que voy pido una ensalada era us asco la lechuga echada a perder

Must visit for a sweet craving! Try the caramel Brownie. Hot chocolate was okish, try the different macarons.

Very busy place and one of the best ambience for group of friends to dine in.

Fantastic Place to visit. We really liked the macaroons. The food is really good. I would suggest to avoid peak times as so many like the place there is almost always a line out the door mid morning for lunch on saturdays.  apparently they are reopening the location downtown.
Such a cute location! If I could have all the salted caramel brownies in the world............ :)

I really liked the atmosphere, the cakes, the fruit and pecan pie. The soup is very good, just a suggestion, don't put so much pepper in it.
I recommend it.
Always a great place to get coffee and good glute free food

Gorgeous looking place inside with some nice quirky seating options. The pastries are selected before the savoury options which is a dangerous thing as they all look delicious and were so tempting!  The chicken salad croissant was delicious and so filling. Also had a bacon, Brie and fig slice that was so flavoursome and moist. A really nice combination of flavours. Shame the outside area was a little small as you have great weather in Charlotte. Overall a lovely experience and recommended for any time of day.
I love this location! The atmosphere is so inviting and the service is very friendly!
I love this bakery & cafe!
The service here is absolutely pathetic compared to the original. You will be in line forever each time.
Beautiful

Jaw-dropping when we entered the premises. On a rainy day and cold temperature, quite a bit were lined up to get their treat. Thanks A for walking us through how to make it more efficient in getting our orders quickly by ordering online. Worth exploring!

Loved the decor,  the coffee, and the cakes and bakes.
Very popular and busy.
The almond tea cakes were amazing, with just the right touch of lemon. Kudos to the staff, too.
Love this location. The atmosphere is very nice and enjoyable. There are so many things to look at and explore in the dining area. The desserts and drinks were fresh and delicious.
Pastry's are good but customer service sucks, the girl at the register doesn't know what's even going on. The French silk pie is amazing tho

Always amazing! Today especially. The entire team slayed it today! Amazing service, and the food was beyond amazing. I love having this place in walking distance to my work! Thanks everyone you really brightened my day!!!

What a fantastic spot for pastries and food!  So glad my family stopped for a dessert platter to take to our friends.  Our 8 month old got to try his first macron and he's a convert!  Super friendly staff and can't wait to try our tasty treats!

Food- tasty and fresh. They seem to make everything from scratch including whipped cream.

Atmosphere - fun and colorful and very lively with a fun art theme inside.

Staff- very friendly and offered great suggestions. The macarons and pistachio eclair are delightful.
We Love Amelie's for the food, treats and atmosphere.
Great selection.  Friendly staff. Delicious desserts.
A great place to try out

Definitely worth a visit! This place has a very unique setup with funky art and wall hangings. Quite large with a lot of seating and outdoor seating. The desserts were delicious and the staff was very pleasant. Worth checking out!
Sticky buns are soooooo good I eat one everyday, macrons are chewy I just don't like the flavors. Sticky buns have changed
Paris was so sweet, kind helpful and I loved seeing a smiling happy face. You should value her here!
Delicious pastries!!! One of the best things is that we can get over there late and have a sweet treat in the evening.
Delicious desserts! Great place to meet friends for some Tea! Love the Interior design and art. Plenty of seats. Constant line on Sunday while we dined in the restaurant.

We threw a baby shower for a friend in a private room and it was amazing! Shanna did such a wonderful job setting up the food and checking in on us! Food was great and I would definitely recommend to anyone thinking of renting out a room for an event
It's a great place to meet up with friends or study. 4-stars because I find their pastries/desserts overly sweet.
Cinnamon bun was excellent!

Absolutely worth the hype - delicious food, good coffee, friendly staff, artsy vibes. A good place to sit and relax with a friend or meet with a group.

I understand that pastries take a lot of time and effort, but they are expensive, just be aware that your total adds up quickly! Also, I wish they had more than one family restroom - out of 8 or 9 bathrooms only one has a baby changing table.

Come on, Amelie's?! What in the world is going on? I've come here many times, old and new location. I decided to try your sandwich today for the first time. I got the chicken salad on toasted gluten free bread w/ a side of fruit. First, the gentleman cashier could not seem to understand what toasted meant. Then, it took 13 minutes to prepare a likely pre-mixed chicken salad on a toasted bread with a cup of fruit. When it arrived, it was cold. The whole thing. Not just the top. I asked the server for some mayo. He brought me a seasoned mayo to spread on a chicken salad sandwich that has a whole different flavoring that would not go along with what he brought me. So, I began to eat without mayo. I got halfway through my fruit and was welcomed with a small hair firmly attached to the honeydew. This was not a good experience today. Also tell the five people standing around at the registers up front that there are likely jobs that could be done; starting with checking on orders and getting them delivered before they get cold. I'm not completely negative. I did love the chocolate gluten-free tea cake.

Went for years to uptown location but they closed. Now I go to Noda location every two weeks to get things for my staff at work.

Absolutely delicious pastries, if they're fresh. Most of the time they can be fixed with a few seconds in the microwave oven. Often in the same box one of the same item will be dry as can be while the one next to it is fresh and squeezable.

Don't be afraid to ask for one from below the counter or a specific one if some in the case look old.

Staff is the same way, nice and fresh or dry and stale.  Some members are so helpful and nice while others are clearly poorly trained or not cut out for a high volume bakery counter.

You'll either have a great or awful experience depending on the day and how the wind is blowing so don't let one experience make you too enthusiastic or too disappointed

I don't have much to say besides "wow." it's obvious that a lot of time and money and thought and love went into making this place, but the best part for me was a guy behind the counter who I assume was a manager. I think his name was Loki or something like that. I mean that person is just magnetic. I'll definitely be back.

Cute place. Super big with lots of tables.  Food is great and pastries are out of this world. I arrived before the lunch rush and after the breakfast rush so it was quiet.  The people are very friendly.  I saw several people working on their laptop there.  It looks like a great place to just hang and get work done while having access to coffee and pastries.

I understand if a place does not accept ESA dogs, but when I entered this establishment with my emotional support dog I was asked if my dog was a service animal to which I told the person that she was not and told him she was ESA. If the guy would have told me she was not allowed in there I would have left but he did not say anything and walked away, later when we got to the cashier we were asked again if she was a service animal to which I gave the same answer and again it seemed that it was ok with them. After we ordered and sat down someone came from the back saying she was not allowed inside, we asked if there was an outside area he told us they had a patio so we went to the patio and sat down to wait for our order, after having all our food and drinks two people came out saying my dog was not even allowed on the patio, that we could sit at the tables in front of the establishment. Once again we complied but not only the tables were dirty but also no one from the staff even offered to help us bring out all our food. This could have been avoided if we were told that my dog was not allowed anywhere on this establishment.
I really want to love the food but I don't. I really like that you can get a pot of tea and the atmosphere is great however

This place is sooooooo nice! I live right behind it in the Noda area and got very excited when they built this one! Went in for the first time today and the food was great as well as my coffee but nothing was better than the friendly staff. Especially Thomas! He was very nice and helpful and had great conversation! Looking forward to coming back
